text:
This message will contain spoilers for some events in both of
Lifewonders LLC's games, Tokyo Afterschool Summoners and LIVE A HERO!

This message may or may not contain special dialogues for some
specific 'Player' name options. Thank you for reading, and please enjoy.

name: PzTJ
text:
How has the previous year been for you, [Player]?
Has it been fun? Has it been enjoyable?

name: PzTJ
text:
Oh, and before you'd 'ask' something,
the one in my 'avatar' field is Ask (アスク).
He looks nice, doesn't he?
From the maimai でっらくす (DELUXE / DX) franchise, a member of Dragon Area (ドラゴンちほー)

options.text: What kind of name is that?

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Yeah, I don't really know either.
Like, who 'ask'ed for that name? Please laugh.

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I'm so sorry for you.
May the Lord give you the insight you truly need in life.

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Based, based, based, based, based.
10 out of 10. Perfection.
Thank you for your most delightful opinion.

name: PzTJ
text:
Now, where were we?
Right, how has this year been for you?

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Congratulations!
I hope this year can keep up that momentum for you!

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I see...
Let us look forward to something brighter, shall we?

name: PzTJ
text:
Did you do something you absolutely regret?
Did someone, something close to you got into something unfortunate?

name: PzTJ
text:
Has school, work, or daily circumstances been weighing on you?
Don't you just want to take a break from it all?

name: PzTJ
text:
Ah, no, that's a bit too dark.
My apologies.

name: PzTJ
text:
Regardless, this year has been one
hell of a rollercoaster, wasn't it?

name: PzTJ
text:
The AI bubble going rampant, the job market set on fire,
the never ending struggle of the people being oppressed...

name: PzTJ
text:
...But despite all that, the Earth still keeps on spinning.
...Barely.

name: PzTJ
text: It's been quite the year for me too.

name: PzTJ
text:
When I say 'quite',
I meant not 'quite' much...

name: PzTJ
text:
If you're a long-time follower of mine,
or hell, someone I know in real life,
chances that you won't see much of my personal life.

name: PzTJ
text:
Because there wasn't much
of me to share to you, that's all.

options.text: You surely must have something you want to do, right?

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Well, yes.
I did have things that I enjoyed doing, that I'd sometimes forget myself and devote my whole being into!

options.text: Surely life was just not doom and gloom, right?

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
It kinda is... But, you're right.
Thanks to some extraordinary people by my side, I was able to live on, and look forward to the future!

name: PzTJ
text:
One of the things that I was really into this year
was attempting to translate some of my favorite Japanese works.
Mainly doujinshis, though...

name: PzTJ
text:
I haven't been studying Japanese for too long,
but I've been able to somewhat grasp the meaning when I'm reading something.

name: PzTJ
text:
I can read and listen to Japanese at an 'okay' level,
but when it comes to speaking and writing...
You won't be seeing me in a JLPT test room any time soon.

name: PzTJ
text:
Though, that's literally the same with me in English.
Imagine getting two 9s and two 6s on IELTS...
Absolutely wasn't me...

name: PzTJ
text:
Anyhow, I really had fun being able to
translate works, even if it's mostly for me to enjoy.

name: PzTJ
text:
Some people asked me what 'the character I got a bit too
smitten is' was, so here's the answer you've been waiting for.

name: PzTJ
text:
But, first of all, I have to give my thanks to そーちゃん (So-chan)
for being the person who have brought me to this point...

name: PzTJ
text:
I discovered his weekly manga series, 'tried' to translate it,
gone through the rest of his discography...

name: PzTJ
text:
I was a on-and-off player of Tokyo Afterschool Summoners at the time,
and I was deterred from trying out LIVE A HERO! since it didn't have an English release.

name: PzTJ
text:
But then, funnily enough, そーちゃん announced that Gnomon was
going to be featured in LIVE A HERO! (and as a distribution character, no less!)

name: PzTJ
text:
I made an account just to get him, but then I wanted to find
out about his story, so I 'translated' it, and then decided to publish it here.

I said 'translated' because it was all on a whim back then...
I didn't know much about LAH's terms, and I really didn't establish any consistency by myself...
I'll redo the event when it eventually gets rerun, trust

name: PzTJ
text:
One dominos falling after another, other LIVE A HERO! characters
started to catch my eyes. I began taking Tokyo Afterschool Summoners
a bit more seriously, and started translating those as well.

name: PzTJ
text:
I'm still salty about Jack Frost and Magical Snowland...
We were robbed of his Special Quest... *sniff*

name: PzTJ
text:
Though, if Lifewonders really needed the budget,
one mention of 'Jack Frost Valentines Alt' would have
me rapidly swiping my magical plastic card to spark him.

name: PzTJ
text:
Anyhow, please do check out そーちゃん's works!
They never fail to put a smile on my face, and even gave me something to look forward to.
Here are some of their really~ good things (that I translated)!

note:
Original: クラスメイト、全員忠犬 (My Classmates, All Faithful Dogs)
Support そーちゃん by reading it on his X / BlueSky / pixiv!

Original: 上野は熱帯夜 (Tropical Night in Ueno)
Support そーちゃん by purchasing it on BOOTH!

Original: 放送部のヒグマ (The Broadcasting Club's Brown Bear)
The work is a bit ancient, but do give it a read on ShonenJump!

name: PzTJ
text:
You might have seen one of those on some
sites for now, but~ if you know, you know.

name: PzTJ
text:
Though, was it surprising, [Player]? The script supported images all along,
but I never actually got the chance to use it.

name: PzTJ
text:
The site hasn't changed too much since its first launch,
but it has had its own ups and downs all the same.

name: PzTJ
text:
Despite that someone suggested a design change to accommodate mobile users,
I wasn't able to make it in time for the year, sorry...

name: PzTJ
text:
Well, that's one more down the list of things I intend to do this year.
Speaking of that, why don't I share some story about this 'project'?

name: PzTJ
text:
If you were wondering about which that I select to translate,
the answer is simple... Whatever I feel like.

name: PzTJ
text:
This... unfortunately causes some problem down the line...
For example, I'd translate a story simply because I liked a singular featured character.

name: PzTJ
text:
I'd get enthusiastic about the first few chapters, and then my motivation
starts to dwindle, either because the story got slightly boring, and/or my favorite
character doesn't start to hold that much of my interest any longer...

name: PzTJ
text:
That lead to a bunch of 'planned' or 'unfinished' stories that never came to be.
One of the most evident exhibits has got to be
with トロピカル・バーンホリデー (Tropical Burn Holiday).

name: PzTJ
text:
Red Hood sparked my interest, I loved Yuma myself
(partly because そーちゃん designed him),
but I failed to get Yuma's tropical variant, and that got me a bit demotivated.

name: PzTJ
text:
Demotivated, I started moving on to the Special Quests to see what was good,
until I realized that I was not built for an entire SQ's worth of text with fragmented speech...

name: PzTJ
text:
By the time I somewhat finished with the main event quests themselves,
I thought to myself that I maybe could handle Yuma's entire SQ.
That turned out horribly wrong.

note:
I struggled to find phrasing that would be appropriate for his pattern of
speech while somehow still having you understand at least the littlest bit of it

name: PzTJ
text:
While Tropical Burn Holiday won't be finished any time soon,
please know that I'll work my way towards it eventually...
(hopefully before Lifewonders starts a rerun on it)

name: PzTJ
text:
Speaking of 'unfinished' or 'unpublished',
here's a bunch of other ones that I never posted!

note:
超大漁！ バトルシップ・フィッシャーズ
(Super Catch! Battleship Fishers)

fun fact: I made this one a long, looong time ago, predating
most of the stories on here, but it was never actually finished

トップオブ・サマーマウンテンズ！～神宿ワンゲル部vs世耕山岳部～
(Top of Summer Mountains! ～Shinjuku Wandervogel Club vs Setagaya Mountaineering Club～)

fun fact 2: this was the first time the background system was introduced,
but never actually published, so the winner went to Tropical Burn Holiday

ゲームマスターズ×エクスターズ ～星外都市の追放選挙～
(Game Masters × Exters ～The Exile Election of the Outer City～)

name: PzTJ
text:
Not only those, there was a lot that I wanted to translate,
like Santa Claus Workout (LAH), Virtual Festa Royale (LAH),
Summer Dive Amusement! (LAH), Valentine Idol Live! (TAS),...

name: PzTJ
text:
Right as I'm writing this, I'm in the middle of doing Christmas Street Fight (TAS),
and I'm intending on doing Whiteout Liberation and New Year 2026 (LAH),...

name: PzTJ
text:
Is this how artists feel when they make a
bunch of WIPs but rarely any finished works ever...?

options.text: Can you please stick to one thing?

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I'm so, so sorry...
It's my bad habit that I really can't fix...

options.text: But you barely even did anything...

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Y-You didn't have to say that out loud...!
It's true, but couldn't you have said something nicer...?

name: PzTJ
text:
Though, despite all of that, I finally felt like
I could do something for the community of the games themselves.

name: PzTJ
text:
This page got featured on LIVE A HERO's unofficial English wiki,
and I was really honored to have the opportunity to contribute
to some of the lore/descriptions' translations there!

name: PzTJ
text:
I found some time to design a version for the heroes' interviews,
and frankly, they were pretty fun to make!

name: PzTJ
text:
Oh... I might have taken a
little bit too much of your time...

name: PzTJ
text: <p2 style="font-size: 130%">Then, let us cut to the chase!

name: PzTJ
text:
Throughout the past year, a lot of people have given me support and comfort,
even if they weren't aware of that themselves.

name: PzTJ
text:
From the bottom of my heart, I'm very much thankful,
but I'm at a loss at how I can repay that favor.

name: PzTJ
text:
Perhaps... I can keep living,
treading on for their sake?

name: PzTJ
text:
Hahaha... What am I even talking about?
■■■■■■■-san, ■■■■■-kun, ■■■■■■, and you too, [Player].

name: PzTJ
text:
Thank you for having pushed me on all this time.
There's not much I could do, but I hope this year will be spectacular for you.

name: PzTJ
text:
Now, I do know that it's a bit late
to celebrate the New Years' now, but...

name: PzTJ
text:
Would you like to join me somewhere?
I promise, I mean no harm at all.

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
A-Ahem...
I mean, I would be delighted if you could join me.

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Now, there's a pretty good place I know downtown.
Let's go have some 'fun' there, shall we?
As you two step outside the cafe's door together, the sunset just behind your back, your shadows seem to meld into one.

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Ah! That's pretty much fine too!
(Let's wait for another chance, then...)

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Say, would you be up for a drink next time?
It's fine if you can't drink, I'd just be delighted if you were to join me!

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text:
It'll be my treat next time.
Consider it a 'thank you' for having spent your time with me today.

dialogue_after_selection.name: PzTJ
dialogue_after_selection.text: Well then, see you next time!
As you two step outside the cafe's door, each of you walking a different path, the sun slowly descended, putting an end to a long day.

text:
someone should hold me off the keyboard next time
I clearly cannot write these things
